info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 9:17AM CDT until April 10 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi...
Bogue Chitto River Near Tylertown affecting Pike and Walthall Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...
Bogue Chitto River Near Bush affecting St. Tammany Parish.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Bogue Chitto River near Bush.
* WHEN...From Tuesday morning to late Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The access road upstream of the bridge will flood. The river will leave the main channel on the left bank below the bridge flooding woodlands on either side of Louisiana Highway 21.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Monday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 11.5 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations.
The next statement will be issued this evening.late tonight at 130 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING
